data.title: Tudela, Cebu Profile – PhilAtlas
data.meta_description: Tudela is a coastal municipality in the province of Cebu, Central Visayas region (Region VII), Philippines. It has a population of 11,304 (2020 Census figures) distributed over 11 barangays.
data.text:
Tudela, Province of Cebu

Summary dataTypemunicipalityIsland groupVisayasRegionCentral Visayas (Region VII)ProvinceCebuBarangay count11Postal code6051Coastal/LandlockedcoastalMarine waterbodiesCamotes SeaPhilippine major island(s)PoroArea (2013)33.02 km2 (12.75 sq mi)Population (2020)11,304Density (2020)342 / km2 (887 / sq mi)Coordinates10° 38' North, 124° 28' East (10.6367, 124.4694)Estimated elevation above sea level7.5 meters (24.7 feet)

Tudela is a coastal municipality in the island province of Cebu.

The municipality has a land area of 33.02 square kilometers or 12.75 square miles which constitutes 0.67% of Cebu's total area. Its population as determined by the 2020 Census was 11,304. This represented 0.34% of the total population of Cebu province, or 0.14% of the overall population of the Central Visayas region. Based on these figures, the population density is computed at 342 inhabitants per square kilometer or 887 inhabitants per square mile.

Barangays

Tudela has 11 barangays as shown in the following table.

Economy

The annual regular revenue of Tudela for the fiscal year of 2016 was ₱46,170,877.52.

End notes:

Annual Regular Income = Locally Sourced Revenue + Internal Revenue Allotment (IRA) Current Year + Other Shares from National Tax Collection

Locally Sourced Revenue = Real Property Tax (General Fund) + Tax on Business + Other Taxes + Regulatory Fees + Service/User Charges + Receipts from Economic Enterprises

Demographics

Households

The household population of Tudela in the 2015 Census was 11,287 broken down into 2,767 households or an average of 4.08 members per household.

Population by age group

According to the 2015 Census, the age group with the highest population in Tudela is 10 to 14, with 1,132 individuals. Conversely, the age group with the lowest population is Under 1, with 163 individuals.

Historical population

The population of Tudela grew from 3,561 in 1903 to 11,304 in 2020, an increase of 7,743 people over the course of 117 years. The latest census figures in 2020 denote a positive growth rate of 0.01%, or an increase of 8 people, from the previous population of 11,296 in 2015.

details

Population of Tudela (1903‑2020)Census datePopulationGrowth rate1903 Mar 23,561–1918 Dec 314,8962.03%1939 Jan 16,7031.58%1948 Oct 16,8370.20%1960 Feb 157,3800.67%1970 May 68,0520.86%1975 May 19,0202.30%1980 May 19,6111.28%1990 May 19,537-0.08%1995 Sep 19,358-0.35%2000 May 110,4012.29%2007 Aug 111,2661.11%2010 May 19,859-4.74%2015 Aug 111,2962.62%2020 May 111,3040.01%

The total number of registered voters or electorate in Tudela for the year 2019 was 8,393, broken down into 4,289 males and 4,104 females.

Location

The municipal center of Tudela is situated at approximately 10° 38' North, 124° 28' East, in the island of Poro. Elevation at these coordinates is estimated at 7.5 meters or 24.7 feet above mean sea level.

Distances

Based on the great-circle distance (the shortest distance between two points over the surface of the Earth), the cities closest to Tudela are Baybay, Leyte, Ormoc, Leyte, Danao, Cebu, Mandaue, Lapu-Lapu, and Bogo, Cebu. The nearest municipalities are Poro, Cebu, San Francisco, Cebu, Pilar, Cebu, Merida, Leyte, Isabel, Leyte, and Inopacan, Leyte. Its distance from the national capital is 578.75 kilometers (359.62 miles). The following list delineates such distance measurements.
